Entries.default: The wall before you is decorated by an intricately-painted mural depicting four sea creatures of legend.
[Inspect the mural.]
[Leave.]

The mural features a kraken, a shark covered in wicked barbs, an enormous whale, and a knot of three serpents with the heads of barracudas.

The images are offset somewhat from their frames, as if they could be pressed.
[Depress the kraken mural.]
[Depress the whale mural.]
[Depress the shark mural.]
[Depress the serpent mural.]
The knot of serpents sinks into the mural with a satisfying click.
[Depress the kraken mural.]
[Depress the shark mural.]
[Depress the whale mural.]
The shape of the barbed shark sinks into the mural with a satisfying click.
[Depress the kraken mural.]
[Depress the whale mural.]
The whale sinks into the mural with a satisfying click.
[Depress the kraken mural.]
As the final piece of the mural sinks into the frame, you hear deep rumble of stone moving behind you.
A puff of foul-smelling gas shoots out of the kraken's mouth. Surprised, you inhale sharply. The gas burns your lungs and face.
Stiletto-thin barbs burst out of the shark's body. You manage to dodge most of them, but one cuts close and leaves a deep gash in your side.
As you reach into the whale's mouth and press, its blunt teeth slam down on your hand with shocking force.
The mechanisms behind the mural reset themselves with a few clicks and the crunch of grinding stone.
The kraken, barbed shark, and massive whale murals still protrude from their frames.
The kraken and whale murals still protrude from their frames.
Only the kraken mural protrudes from the frame now.
Only the kraken mural protrudes from the frame now.
The kraken and whale murals still protrude from their frames.
The kraken, barbed shark, and massive whale murals still protrude from their frames.
